bibl.title: Report from Harry Frederick Jackson to the Post Adjutant, Columbia Barracks, July 29, 1901

div1.p: Jackson reports on the condition of “Johnny's Place” which has been inspected by Echeverria. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Report from Harry Frederick Jackson to the Post Adjutant, Columbia Barracks, July 29, 1901
div1.opener:
FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
misc letters received
Dept of Cuba 1900-1901
Echeverria
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA
Office of Assistant Engineer
-----
Quemados, July 29, 1901.
The Post Adjutant,
Columbia Barracks, Cuba.
Sir:
div1.p:
Referring to telephonic message of the Commanding Officer re-
ceived on July 27th in regard to the house known as “Johnny's place”
in Real St., I have the honor to inform you that this place has been
inspected by Dr. Echeverria and the owner has been notified to clean
and repair it.

The owner of the Chinese Laundry has been fined $2.00 for having
water containing mosquito larvae on his premises.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, H.F. Jackson 1st Lieut. Art'y Corps, U. S. A.,
Assistant Engineer.
L. R. No. 2769/Post/190
Received JUL 31 1901
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA,
Quemados, July 29, 1901.
H. F. Jackson,
1st Lieut., Artillery Corps,
Assistant Engineer.
States that the house known
as “Johnny's Place” (Quemados)
has been inspected and the own-
er notified to clean and repair
it; that the owner of the Chinese
laundry has been fined $2.00 for
having water containing mosqui-
to larvae on his premises.
FILED JUL 31, 1901
